controller.timer

Class GameTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • controller.timer.GameTimer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGameTimer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CountdownTimer, SpeedDemonTimer, TraditionalTimer

    public abstract class GameTimer
extends java.util.Observable
implements IGameTimer
    Abstract Observable timer that implements the Template Method. Tracks how long the game has been played and provides a means for allowing various ways of counting time. Notifies any observers when the time has changed
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Steven Proctor

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      private int period
      The period of milliseconds betwwen each execution of the timerTask
      (package private) boolean reset
      Resets time to it's original value
      (package private) int time
      The current time used by concrete GameTimer classes.
      (package private) int timeDelay
      The number of milliseconds to wait before starting the timerTask
      private java.util.Timer timer
      The Timer used to schedule the timerTask
      private java.util.TimerTask timerTask
      The TimerTask that changes the current time

    • Field Detail

      • masterTime

        private int masterTime
        The amount of time the game has been running. Can only count up.

      • time

        int time
        The current time used by concrete GameTimer classes. Can increment up or down.

      • reset

        boolean reset
        Resets time to it's original value

      • timeDelay

        int timeDelay
        The number of milliseconds to wait before starting the timerTask

      • period

        private int period
        The period of milliseconds betwwen each execution of the timerTask

      • timer

        private java.util.Timer timer
        The Timer used to schedule the timerTask

      • timerTask

        private java.util.TimerTask timerTask
        The TimerTask that changes the current time

        Stores whether the timer is running

      • start

        public void start()
        Creates the timer task and starts the timer. The incrementTime and resetTime methods are defined by the concrete classes
